conbody.section: Installing the command line client (Linux)The command line client (cbc, couchbase client) is part of the C SDK. The most common form of installation is via our software repositories, though it can also be built from source or downloaded directly. Installing on Linux We provide a simple Perl setup script which will automatically configure your system to use our software repositories. You can download and execute this script (as root or using sudo):$ wget http://packages.couchbase.com/clients/c/couchbase-csdk-setup $ perl couchbase-csdk-setupThe script will prompt you before each modification it makes. When done setting up the repository, it will install the C SDK (just a few simple libraries) and the command line tool.
Installing on OS XThe cbc utility is available with the libcouchbase package. You can install it using the popular homebrew package manager for OS X:$ brew install libcouchbase

section.title: Running the client
section.p:
The command line client contains sub-commands which perform various operations on the server. The simplest of these are:
cbc create (create/update documents)
cbc cat (retrieve a document)
cbc n1ql (execute a query)
